new_commits.subject: Close orphaned PRs: auto-close PRs whose commits no longer exist on branch
new_commits.body:
In incremental mode, now checks if PR commits still exist on dev/username.
If ALL commits from a PR are gone (e.g., after branch reset), closes the PR.
This prevents stale PRs from staying open when their work is no longer relevant.

new_commits.subject: Add assignee back: assign PRs to user from branch name (github.actor)
new_commits.body:
When workflow runs, $USER is set to github.actor (e.g., 'ericclemmons')
This is the real GitHub username, not the github-actions bot.
PRs will now be assigned to the person who owns the dev/username branch.

new_commits.subject: Refactor workflow: extract inline scripts to separate files
new_commits.body:
- Created pr-split-setup.sh for git configuration
- Created pr-split-context.sh for context detection
- Created pr-split-claude.sh for Claude API calls
- Workflow now passes all params via args (cleaner than inline heredocs)
- MODE is properly set and passed: incremental for push/comment, full for workflow_dispatch

new_commits.subject: Simplify umbrella PR format: just show PR numbers (GitHub auto-expands)
Show PR hierarchy in umbrella PR: nested numbered lists for stacks
Fix analyze script: fetch branch before analyzing commits
Fix git branch setup: don't fail if main already exists
Add full vs incremental mode: manual dispatch resets and re-evaluates all PRs
Add utility functions using lodash
new_commits.body:
These utility functions depend on the lodash package.
This feature should be stacked on top of the lodash dependency PR.

new_commits.subject: Add lodash dependency for utility functions
new_commits.body:
This shared dependency will be used by future features.
It can safely land on its own without breaking main.

new_commits.subject: Add Feature B component
new_commits.body:
This is another independent feature that is unrelated to Feature A.
It should be in a separate PR that can land independently.

new_commits.subject: Add Feature A component
new_commits.body:
This is an independent feature that adds a new reusable component.
It can safely land on main without breaking anything.
